results.title: The Princess diaries
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Mario Iscovich and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Mia Thermopolis is a bright but terribly shy and gawky teenager whose goal in life is to survive each school day with a minimum of attention and embarrassment. Unfortunately, her wish to be invisible is thwarted when her strict grandmother arrives and delivers the shocking news that she’s a real-life princess - heir to the throne of Genovia. Based on the novel by Meg Cabot. Cast includes Anne Hathaway, Heather Matarazzo, Hector Elizondo, Julie Andrews, Mandy Moore, Caroline Goodall.

results.title: I'll cry tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Daniel Mann, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Biographical film about American singer actress Lillian Roth, her rise to fame in Hollywood and on Broadway and her eventual downhill path into self-destruction and alcoholism brought on by a series of ill-fated relationships and a domineering ambitious mother. Susan Hayward is superbe in her portrayal of Roth and equally Jo Van Fleet in the role of Roth’s mother. Cast also includes Richard Conte, Eddie Albert and Don Taylor. Based on the book of the same title by Lillian Roth, Mike Connolly and Gerold Frank. (Award: Oscar for Best Costume Design (Helen Rose))

results.title: Gold diggers Of 1933
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Mervyn LeRoy, Jack L. Warner, Robert Lord and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Dick Powell and Ruby Keeler play two young hopefuls struggling to make it on Broadway. Even falling in love has its hardships, as Powell’s high-brow Eastern family is determined to break them (and the show) up. More complications set in when his brother falls for Keeler’s wise-cracking roommate. Cast also includes Warren William, Joan blondell, Ginger Rogers. Based on a play by Avery Hopwood. Musical numbers created and directed by Busby Berkeley.

results.title: Words and music
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A musical version of the lives and work of Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart featuring twenty-two of their songs. Cast includes Mickey Rooney (Lorenz Hart), Tom Drake (Richard Rodgers), Marshall Thompson, Janet Leigh, Betty Garrett, Ann Sothern, June Allyson, Perry Como, Judy Garland, Lena Horne, Gene Kelly.

results.title: Around the world under the sea
results.brief_description: Action adventure film about a group of scientists led by Dr Doug Standish (Lloyd Bridges) who set out in a submarine to plant sensors along the world’s ocean floors as an early warning earthquake alert following worldwide increased seismic activity. Cast includes Brian Kelly, David McCallum, Keenan Wynn, Marshall Thompson, Gary Merrill, Shirley Eaton.

results.title: Roadgames = Road games [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Richard Franklin, Essaness Pictures and Quest Films
results.brief_description: A psychopathic killer is haunting the Nullarbor Highway in search of female hitch-hikers whom he picks up, rapes, kills and dismembers. An eccentric, long-haul truck driver determines to track down the murderer and is helped by a young hitch-hiker he picks up. Stars Stacy Keach and Jamie Lee Curtis.

results.title: Dimboola [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, John Weiley and Pram Factory Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Hibberd’s famous stage comedy is brought to the screen by director John Duigan (“The Year My Voice Broke”). The wedding of Morrie (played by Bruce Spence) to Maureen (Natalie Bate) in the small country town of Dimboola is the setting for this story of “typical Aussie ratbags and oddballs doing typically dim-witted Aussie things usually whilst chucking back a tinnie and trying to crack on to a sheila” (according to critic Bernard Hemingway). A visiting English journalist (played by Max Gillies) observes and comments on the action. Filmed on location at Dimboola in western Victoria, and including many of the cast from the Australian Performing Group’s highly successful theatrical production, “Dimboola” is a colourful and uniquely Australian romp. Cast also includes Bill Garner, Evelyn Krape, Max Cullen, Max Fairchild, and Chad Morgan. This DVD edition also includes a filmed version of the original play as performed at the Pram Factory in 1973 and a 1994 documentary on the Australian Performing Group with some wonderful archival footage.

results.title: Hoodwink [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Claude Whatham, Errol Sullivan, Pom Oliver, New South Wales Film Corporation and CB Films (France)
results.brief_description: John Hargreaves stars as Martin Stang, a character based on a real-life bank robber and conman, in this Australian “crime caper” film. Martin attempts to ease the burden of his time in a New South Wales jail by pretending to be blind. While he succeeds in fooling the authorities into giving him special treatment, unexpected complications arise when Martin meets Sarah, (Judy Davis) the wife of a local lay preacher, and becomes emotionally involved. The stellar Australian cast also includes Wendy Hughes, Colin Friels, Max Cullen, Michael Caton and Geoffrey Rush in his first film role. Judy Davis won the 1981 AFI Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role for her performance.

results.title: Meet me in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Roy Rowland, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: While vacationing in Las Vegas with his mother, a wealthy Nevada rancher meets a ballet dancer who brings him luck at the roulette wheel. Shot on location in the renowned Sands Hotel, the film captures the glitz and glamour of the neon-lit gamblers’ paradise in its martini-era prime and features numerous cameo appearances by famous actors and Las Vegas entertainers including Frank Sinatra, Paul Henreid, Lena Horne, Frankie Laine and Peter Lorre. A song and dance highlight, featuring Cyd Charisse, is the thirteen minute bop parody of the ballad ‘Frankie and Johnny’ with special lyrics by Sammy Cahn sung by Sammy Davis Jr. Other songs include ‘The Gal With The Yaller Shoes’, ‘If You Can’t Dream’, ‘My Lucky Charm’, ‘Hell Hath No Fury’, ‘I Refuse To Rock ‘N Roll’

results.title: The Man who came to dinner
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Hal B. Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: While on a lecture tour an acid-tongued celebrity (Whiteside) and his secretary accept a dinner invitation from the Stanleys. Unfortunately on arriving at the Stanley’s home, Whiteside slips on the ice and breaks his hip subsequently finding himself confined to the Stanley’s home. During his recuperation Whiteside manages to cause chaos and mayhem with his interfering and upsetting comments. Based on the Broadway hit by George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart, and adapted for the screen by Julius and Philip Epstein. Cast includes Bette Davis, Ann Sheridan, Monty Woolley, Jimmy Durante, Billie Burke, Reginald Gardiner.
